short_description: Experience the vibrant island of Barbados, where pristine beaches meet rich culture and history. Discover world-class diving, rum distilleries, cricket heritage, colonial architecture, and the warm hospitality of the Bajan people in this Caribbean paradise.

health.tap_water_safety: Safe to drink - Barbados has excellent water quality
alcohol_info: It is prohibited to sell, serve, or offer alcohol beverages to anyone under the age of 18
Alcohol can be purchased from licensed venues, restaurants, and stores
Barbados is famous for its rum production and distilleries

tipping.hotels: Tipping is appreciated for porters ($1-2 per bag) and housekeeping ($2-5 per day)
tipping.guides: 10-15% tip is appreciated for tour guides
tipping.restaurants: 10-15% tip is customary for good service, though some restaurants may include a service charge
tipping.taxis: Tipping is appreciated but not mandatory, rounding up is common

weather.title: Barbados has a tropical climate with warm temperatures year-round. The dry season runs from December to May, while the wet season is from June to November, with the highest chance of hurricanes from August to October.

when_to_visit.title: Dry Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Perfect weather with low humidity, minimal rainfall, and warm temperatures. This is the peak tourist season, ideal for beach activities, water sports, diving, and outdoor adventures. Best time for snorkeling and exploring the island

when_to_visit.title: Shoulder Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Warm temperatures with occasional brief showers. Fewer crowds and lower prices make this a great time to visit. Still excellent weather for beach activities, water sports, and exploring the island

when_to_visit.title: Crop Over Festival
when_to_visit.short_description: Experience the vibrant Crop Over festival with colorful parades, music, and cultural celebrations. Peak of the summer season with warm weather and festive atmosphere

when_to_visit.title: Wet Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Higher humidity and more frequent rain showers, with peak hurricane season in September and October. Lower prices and fewer tourists, but be aware of weather conditions

weather.best_time: The best time to visit Barbados is during the dry season from December to May when the weather is perfect with low humidity, minimal rainfall, and ideal conditions for beach activities, water sports, and outdoor adventures
